uk.co.saiman.acquisition

Interface AcquisitionDevice

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HardwareDevice

    public interface AcquisitionDevice
extends HardwareDevice
    Software module for acquisition of SampledContinuousFunction data through some mechanism. Typically continuous function data may correspond to a mass spectrum.

    • Method Detail

      • startAcquisition

        void startAcquisition()
        Begin an acquisition experiment with the current configuration, and wait until it is complete.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if acquisition is already in progress

      • stopAcquisition

        void stopAcquisition()
        Stop any acquisition experiment that may be in progress.

      • abortOperation

        default void abortOperation()
        Description copied from interface: HardwareDevice
        If the hardware module is performing some sort of operation, e.g. a currently running raster or acquisition card, that operation should be aborted, or for high voltages they should be turned off if possible.
        Specified by:
        abortOperation in interface HardwareDevice

      • isAcquiring

        boolean isAcquiring()
        Returns:
        true if the module is currently in acquisition, false otherwise

      • getSampleIntensityUnits

        javax.measure.Unit<javax.measure.quantity.Dimensionless> getSampleIntensityUnits()
        Returns:
        the units of measurement of sample intensities

      • getSampleTimeUnits

        javax.measure.Unit<javax.measure.quantity.Time> getSampleTimeUnits()
        Returns:
        the units of measurement of sample times

      • getLastAcquisitionData

        SampledContinuousFunction<javax.measure.quantity.Time,javax.measure.quantity.Dimensionless> getLastAcquisitionData()
        Returns:
        The last acquired acquisition data. This leaves the format of the acquired data to the discretion of the implementing hardware module.

      • dataEvents

        uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.Observable<SampledContinuousFunction<javax.measure.quantity.Time,javax.measure.quantity.Dimensionless>> dataEvents()
        Add or remove data event observers.

        The observers may be triggered with data events that happen outside the scope of an actual acquisition experiment, in the case of an "always on" instrument setup. In this case, the isAcquiring() method will indicate whether the event is related to an experiment if invoked by a listener to a data event.

        Returns:
        an observable interface for registering data event listeners

      • startEvents

        uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.Observable<AcquisitionDevice> startEvents()
        Listener for experiment start events.

        During listener invocation for a start event, the device state is guaranteed to reflect the configuration of the starting experiment, e.g. getAcquisitionCount(), getSampleDepth(), etc.

        Returns:
        an observable interface for registering start event listeners

      • endEvents

        uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.Observable<Optional<AcquisitionException>> endEvents()

      • errors

        uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.Observable<AcquisitionException> errors()
        Specified by:
        errors in interface HardwareDevice

      • setAcquisitionCount

        void setAcquisitionCount(int count)
        Set the total acquisition count for a single experiment.
        Parameters:
        count - the number of continua to acquire for a single experiment

      • getAcquisitionCount

      • getSampleResolution

        javax.measure.Quantity<javax.measure.quantity.Time> getSampleResolution()
        Get the time resolution between each sample in the acquired sampled continuous function. Unless otherwise specified by a subclass this may be considered to be a constant.
        Returns:
        the sample resolution in milliseconds

      • getSampleFrequency

        javax.measure.Quantity<javax.measure.quantity.Frequency> getSampleFrequency()
        Get the sample frequency in the acquired sampled continuous function. Unless otherwise specified by a subclass this may be considered to be a constant.
        Returns:
        the sample frequency

      • setAcquisitionTime

        void setAcquisitionTime(javax.measure.Quantity<javax.measure.quantity.Time> time)
        Set the active sampling duration for a single data acquisition event. This may adjust the acquisition depth to fit according to the current acquisition resolution.
        Parameters:
        time - the time an acquisition will last in milliseconds

      • getAcquisitionTime

        javax.measure.Quantity<javax.measure.quantity.Time> getAcquisitionTime()
        Get the active sampling duration for a single data acquisition event.
        Returns:
        the time an acquisition will last in milliseconds

      • setSampleDepth

        void setSampleDepth(int depth)
        Set the number of samples in an acquired sampled continuous function. This may adjust the acquisition time to fit according to the current acquisition resolution.
        Parameters:
        depth - the sample depth for an acquired data array

      • getSampleDepth

        int getSampleDepth()
        Get the number of samples in an acquired sampled continuous function.
        Returns:
        the sample depth for an acquired data array

        default RegularSampledDomain<javax.measure.quantity.Time> getSampleDomain()
